bug.author: dynamicwebpaige
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Existing URLs containing the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/AggregationMethod>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/AggregationMethod</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
Correct Links https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/python/ops/gradients_util.py is incorrect. The correct link should be https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/gradients_util.py.
Clear Description The description is not opinionated about when to use this symbol, and unclear on what aggregation methods for combining gradients would be useful for.
Usage Example No usage example is provided.
Parameters Defined Parameters are poorly defined, and not formatted appropriately.
Returns Defined Returns are not defined.
Raises Listed and Defined Errors are not defined.
Visuals, if Applicable No visuals are included.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link> I'm interested in working on this issue!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link> Can I please work on this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rajiv2605>@Rajiv2605</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ayush517>@Ayush517</denchmark-link> - Absolutely! Any contributions that improve our API docs are extremely welcome.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/AggregationMethod>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/AggregationMethod</denchmark-link>
While opening the link on this page, I am getting redirected to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/gradients_util.py>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/gradients_util.py</denchmark-link> which is the correct link mentioned in the issue. It's working fine I think. Seems like most of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Atype%3Adocs+%5BTF+2.0+API+Docs%5D+is%3Aopen>these issues</denchmark-link> with broken links were solved.
Is this issue still open? as the status is still open here can should I work on it? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link>

How to use tf.AggregationMethod in tf2.0. In tf1.0 it can be passthrough the optimizer.minimize(loss, method_aggregation = tf.AggregationMethod.EXPERIMANTAL_TREE) And it can help if GPU is OOM. But how to use that in TF 2.0?
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link> , Is this issue still Open? Asking so that I can work on it? Thanks and Gratitude!

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chinmoysarangi>@chinmoysarangi</denchmark-link> , Paige has a <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_ref>lot of these bugs</denchmark-link> , I doubt she working on this particular one right now. Also if you're working on api pages be sure to have a look at <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_ref>this doc</denchmark-link> .
Is the issue still open? I'm interested to contribute
can I work on this issue?
The links on this page are fixed.
